RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 37. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLESS D'SOUTH vied for the lead, raced in the four path, rated just off of the leaders hip, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, matched strides, was encouraged at the quarter pole and took the lead, was urged and encouraged through the stretch and was able to hold on for the maiden breaking win. GJDE. OCEAN FLEET was mid pack and raced on the rail, saved ground, shifted into the four path in the stretch and closed, second best. BISTINEAU BELLE raced in mid pack in the two path, shifted into the four path at the half mile pole, circled after the three eighths pole, closed in the stretch with a mild bid getting up fo r third. CHATAIN'S EAGLE was four side and mid pack, advanced and angled into the six path after the half, shifted out again and circled the field in the turn, was eight wide in the stretch and closed. THAT IS AWESOME vied for the lead in the two path, set the pace, was pressured by an outside foe through out, was challenged at the five sixteenth pole, matched strides until relinquishing the lead at the quarter pole, followed down the stretch and faded. SAVANNAH BANANA was off a bit slow, was allowed to find her stride while racing in the three path, gained ground and was in contention, was urged and encouraged, shifted in towards the rail late, but to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Bistineau Belle
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, angled 4 wide, 1/2, bid 3/8, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Savannah Banana
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, 3w, gained ground, but to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean Fleet
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, led, rail, shifted 4 wide, upper, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Chatain's Eagle
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, moved 1/2, 6w, circled, 8 wide, upper, closed

ENTRY.NAME: That Is Awesome
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pressured, relinquished, followed, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Bless d'South
ENTRY.OWNER: Haas Margaret Lanetta and Womack Larry D
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 4w, rated, challenged 5-16th, led 1/4, encouraged, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 4, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf cours e, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ATTA PARTY raced in the three path and stalked the pace, improved position down the back side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled through the turn and challenged for the lead at the eighth pole, battled with two rivals briefly and willingly drew off for the win. BAYOU BEAUX raced in the three path, was in the middle of the field and improved position, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field in the seven path, was wide in the upper stretch and closed under encouragement, enough for second. BIBLEMAN vied for the lead, raced two wide and set the pace, showed the way until the quarter pole then tired late. MORRICONE raced from mid pack, was two wide, launched a mild bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out five wide in the lane and closed with a mile bid. BISPING stalked the pace and found the rail, saved ground on the rail through out, challenged for the lead at the eighth pole, battled, gave way. ANALYZER was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Analyzer
ENTRY.COMMENT: was never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Morricone
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, angled 5 wide stretch, maintained

ENTRY.NAME: Bayou Beaux
ENTRY.OWNER: Gillis, Betty J. and Joseph A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, circled 7w, closed, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Bisping
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, stalked, saved ground, battled 1/8, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Bibleman
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 2w, set the pace, collared at the 1/4, tired ;late

ENTRY.NAME: Atta Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, advanced backside, bid 3/8, led 1/8, out finished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 100. Claiming Purse 14000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE APRIL 4, 2023. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KING OF THE COURT raced in the four path as he stalked the leaders, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field and was encouraged through the turn, took the lead at the quarter pole and held sway for the win. HIS GIANT vied for the lead in the three path, took the lead and attended the pace, showed the way until the quarter pole, held on for second. HULEN was racing in the two path from off of the pace, shifted into the four path at the five sixteenth pole, shifted out again at the eighth pole as he found his best stride and got up for third. HOMEVIEW was on the inside in the three path as he raced in a set from mid pack with another foe, saved ground and shifted into the two path in the upper stretch, closed but finished flat. TRACK SMART stalked the front runners on the rail, saved ground through out, was in contention and had racing room but no late kick. TWO DOT trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Track Smart
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, saved ground, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Hulen
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, off pace, shifted 4 wide, 5-16th, 6 wide, 1/8, best stride

ENTRY.NAME: His Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led pace, collared 1/4, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Homeview
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, matched strides, saved ground 2w, flat

ENTRY.NAME: Two Dot
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

ENTRY.NAME: King of the Court
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, stlkd, bid3/8 ,urged, circled, led1/4, held sway

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: W. Bruce Lunsford & Hill 'n' Dale Farm

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET TAVERN vied for the lead, engaged in a match race with two other entries on the inside, put distance between themselves and the rest of the filed, battled into the stretch, shook his two mates took control of the race and drew off proving to be the best of this field today. DUMBSTRUCK was off a bit slow, found himself well off of the pace, raced in the three path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, raced in between foes at the five sixteenth pole, shifted out into the 8 path in the upper stretch, was cued and responded to encouragement willing, passed rivals and closed nicely, struggled to switch leads but was able to get up for second. MAX IS G MONEY was well off of the pace early on, stayed on the rail and saved ground and he found his stride, improved position and had clean racing room through the turn, closed willingly on the rail, passed a rival near the eighth pole, shifted out into the three path to pass another set of tiring rivals, was kept in stride and did not break momentum, continued to close to the wire, just missed for second, but ran a very game third. LOUDERMILK vied for the lead, raced between to other rivals who were also determined to dominate the speed of the race, battled in this front running pack until the eight pole, then tired. LOUDTHUNDRHEVYRAIN raced from mid pack in the three path, maintained position through out, had no late kick. WINONESOON was off of the pace and in the four path, improved position by the three eighths pole, shifted into the two path at the five sixteenth pole, tired. MR. SHORTY vied for the lead, raced on the rail, was in a battle for the lead with two other rivals, did not want to back down and fought until the quarter pole then tired. GONE ELVIS raced on the rail in the middle of the field with another rival to his outside, saved ground through out, tired in the stretch. HERCULES N LOVE raced in the middle of the field in the four and five path, was on the far outside through out, maintained position through the stretch drive and faded late. STRONG DIAMOND trailed through out.

ENTRY.NAME: Gone Elvis
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, improved, saved ground, tired stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Max Is G Money
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, saved ground, passed up rail, shifted out 4w, cls

ENTRY.NAME: Dumbstruck
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, offpce, 3w, bid 3/8, between 5-16th, shifted 8w, left

ENTRY.NAME: Loudthundrhevyrain
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, mid pack, maintained position

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Shorty
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led, battled, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Loudermilk
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 2w, saved ground tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Winonesoon
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, shifted 2w, flat

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Tavern
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, 3waybattle, set the pace, outside, led, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Hercules N Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: mw, outside trip, maintained position

ENTRY.NAME: Strong Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed through out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since June 4 Allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRAWBERRY SUNDAE vied for the lead, controlled the pace, was un contested as she went wire to wire. SIXTH ANNIVERSARY was racing mid pack and in the four path, rated down the back side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, hooked another competitor at the five sixteenth pole battled with that one down the stretch and into the furlong ground, could not overcome the winner but managed to hold off the rest, doing enough for the place spot. ANITA'S VISION stalked the front runner from the inside in the two path, saved ground and improved position, moved into the second flight through the turn on the inside, shifted out into the three path in an effort to move out from behind the leader, hooked an outside closing rival, battled until the aftert he sixteenth then chased hold in go for third. DREWSILLA raced in the rail from mid pack, was in hands and relaxed, moved at the half mile pole, shifted into the four path at the quarter pole, responded well to urging and closed into the furlong ground but to no avail. MS. CAJUN QUEEN was in the four path and racing from off of the pace, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field through the turn, then faded. DEROUTANTE was off a bit slow, raced in the three path, was well off of the pace and never got involved. BE A BANDIT was racing two and three wide, stalked the front runner then tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Drewsilla
ENTRY.OWNER: Roe Steve D and Roe Patricia L
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, in hands, moved 1/2, shifted 4w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Strawberry Sundae
ENTRY.OWNER: Tompkins Richard Anthony and Reeves Kathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led pace, unchallenged, contested wire to wire winner

ENTRY.NAME: Anita's Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, advanced inside, shifted out 3w, hooked, chased

ENTRY.NAME: Be a Bandit
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w, stalked, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Sixth Anniversary
ENTRY.COMMENT: midpack ,4w, rated, bid 3/8, hooked foe 5-16th, closed willingly,

ENTRY.NAME: Deroutante
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, well off the pace, 3w, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Cajun Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, off pace, bid 3/8, circled the field, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 4, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claimi ng Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAESTRIA vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the pace, and went un contested through out. MYFRIENDSAWINNER was off in the middle of the filed, raced on the rail and had a ground saving trip, improved position as she closed, cut made the turn at the quarter pole took advantage of the ground saving trip, could not catch the winner but drew ahead of the rest, drifted out in the stretech but was still second best. ATOMIC ROSE was well off of the pace and racing in the three path, saved ground through out, launched a bid at the three eighths pole ,was asked and responded well by closing willingly and out finishing the rest. FUNTIMEGIRL was off a step slow, was well off the pace, traveled in the four path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, closed well. ITSNOTMYJOB was off in the five path, raced there in the middle of the field, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the field, shifted out six wide in the upper stretch to n oavail. SAY WHAT raced on the rail in the two path, raced in between horses but showed little over all. LOTS OF GOLD raced in the three path, stalked the pace, shuffled back, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Myfriendsawinner
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, drifted 5w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Maestria
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led, unchallenged, contested winner

ENTRY.NAME: Say What
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, 2w, off pace, btwn, showed little

ENTRY.NAME: Lots of Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w, stalked, shuffled back, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Itsnotmyjob
ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w, mid pack, bid 3/8, circled, 6 wide, upper

ENTRY.NAME: Funtimegirl
ENTRY.OWNER: Prather, John H. and Linda K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 4w, bid 3/8, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, saved ground, shifted 2w, out finished the rest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR. WULLY BULLY was well off of the pace and in no hurry in the early stages of the race, raced on the rail and saved ground, settled in hands, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out four wide, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, battled with three other rivals in the upper stretch, shook those two and continued to battle with one other rival until the sixteenth pole, put that one away and drew off convincingly. FLYING CAROLINA was off slow and off of the pace, raced in the four path on the outside, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, circled the filed, challenged the two front runners for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, shook those two front runners and battled on down the lane with an outside foe, battled until after the sixteenth pole and gave way. MR LEO AND JOSE stalked the leader in the two path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, shifted out into the three path, challenged for the lead at the five sixteenth pole, battled, was joined by two other competitors, gave way. WINDTAPPER WIN raced on the rail in the middle of the field, improved position, started to launch a bid nearing the three eighths pole on the inside, steadied, then faded. CAMALEON vied for the lead, raced on the rail, led, shifted down to the rail in the upper stretch, battled with another contender, was joined by two other fast closing rivals and gave way. PERIPATETIC was keen early while racing on the rail, angled out into the four path is the first urn, settled a bit and stalked the leader, the tired at the quarter pole. RONALDS GATSBY raced mid pack, in the three a oth, raced in between rivals but was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Peripatetic
ENTRY.COMMENT: keen, rail, angled out 4 wide, 1st, settled, stalked, tired 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Leo and Jose
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, bid 3/8, shifted out 5-16th, challenged 5-16th, batt

ENTRY.NAME: Windtapper Win
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail, mid pack, steadied 3/8, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Camaleon
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail ,led, shifted rail, battled, collared, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Wully Bully
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, in hands, bid 1/2, circled, challenged 5-16th, up

ENTRY.NAME: Ronalds Gatsby
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, btwn, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Carolina
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, off slow, 4w, bid 3/8, circled, challenged 5-16th, 2nd
